book.of.workflow 1.2.3
  • Reference

    Export Tabular Data From R to DBMS

    export_data.Rd

    export_data serves as a wrapper for dbWriteTable and dbAppendTable. When using append=FALSE, the operation is destructive as the target table is dropped if it exists, so use this function with caution.

    export_data(
  this.conn,
  out.data,
  tbl = NULL,
  sch = "dbo",
  append = FALSE,
  persist.conn = TRUE,
  ...
)

    Arguments

    this.conn

    A DBI-package connection object

    out.data

    The data to write to the database, preferably a data.frame or coercible

    tbl

    (string) The name of the table to drop (if it exists) and create

    sch

    (string) The name of the schema in which to create the table

    append

    (logical) Should the data be appended to existing data rather than replacing existing data?

    persist.conn

    (logical | TRUE) When FALSE, the connection will be closed at the end of execution

    ...

    Additional arguments passed to dbWriteTable

    See also

    Other Data transmission: get_data(), make_query()

    Contents
